page.title: 19CHINESE COMMUNITY,MILL HILL.
page.content: In{January},1985,a{House of Commons} report highlighted the{Chinese}as the most{neglected}of our ethnic{ {minorities,}and within days the local Chinese,led by{Hon Tin Fu},had negotiated with{Mary Chadwick},the{ {Community Centre Warden,}for the use of the building every Sunday.Within three weeks a{school}teaching{Chinese {language and culture}to{children}was operational.As parents were native speaking,Catonese,Vietnamese or Hakka (the dialect of Hong Kong)and many had limited English,{classes for adults} also started teaching English. Parents had to bring children,and used the waiting time for {social and {recreational}purposes eg.playing Mah-Jong,Chinese chess and card games ,snooker,table tennis etc.This led to the formation of the{Chinese Community {Association}which supports the sick.
